item.title: Small Business Investment Company Modernization Act of 2013

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

item.text: Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 113-309.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

summary.text: Small Business Investment Company Modernization Act of 2013 - Amends the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to increase from $225 million to $350 million the maximum amount of outstanding leverage to be made available by the Small Business Administration (SBA) to two or more commonly controlled small business investment companies not under capital impairment.

bill.title: Small Business Investment Company Modernization Act of 2013

item.title: Small Business Investment Company Modernization Act of 2013
Small Business Investment Company Modernization Act of 2013
A bill to amend the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to provide for increased limitations on leverage for multiple licenses under common control, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 113-309.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
